meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite groovy game reviewer here to give you the lowdown on No More Heroes III.

Before we dive in, I just want to say that I'm feeling pretty extra special today. Maybe it's because I managed to cram my hair into a particularly impressive afro this morning, or maybe it's because I've been practicing my best "rock on" gesture for hours (it takes skill, people). Whatever the reason, I'm feeling like the king of the gaming world, and I'm ready to bring you all the tea on No More Heroes III.

Now, let's get down to business. What do our esteemed critics have to say about this game? Well, Nintendo Force Magazine gave it a score of 95, saying that it's a violent action game that's also an open-world do-gooder sim and a tribute to "popcorn classic blockbusters" all in one (yeah, I didn't quite get what they meant by that either). The Mako Reactor gave it an 85, praising its brilliant writing, superlative boss fights, and sublime soundtrack. GameMAG and Screen Rant both gave it an 80, saying that it's a special game with a soul of its own (even if it has some technical issues).

But then, things start to get a little messy. Meristation only gave it a 75, which is pretty meh if you ask me. And NintendoWorldReport? Forget about it. They gave it a 65 and said that the game is half-baked in the most literal sense (ouch!). GameSpot, on the other hand, was not impressed at all, giving it a paltry 40.

So, what's my take on No More Heroes III? Well, let me tell you – I had an absolute blast playing this game! The combat is fast-paced and exciting, the boss fights are epic, and the soundtrack is straight fire. I mean, sure, there are some technical issues here and there (I had a few moments where my character just froze in place for no reason), but overall, I think this game is a real winner.

Of course, your mileage may vary. If you're looking for a super serious, by-the-book experience, then No More Heroes III might not be the game for you. But if you're willing to roll with its quirks and have a little fun, then I say go for it!

That's my two cents on No More Heroes III – hope you enjoyed this review as much as I did!
